                                                             26:01 min


If your electronic household appliances wrote love songs while you
were away on vacation, their happy pops and clicks would sweep through
the neighborhood and you would return home to find chipper crowds of
people singing along to fluffy pop melodies drifting from the windows.



Alpine Station review:



"As Adam Young, the artist behind Owl City self-acknowledges, his
music might be something akin to "girly cell phone music" but his
melodic mastery is undeniable. "Of June" contains sparkling electronic
pop gems that are equally beautiful and inspiring. Both charming and
perfectly orchestrated, this debut blends lyrical charm and aesthetic
glamour into fluffy mountains of candy-coated melody that will be sure
to leave you in a sparkling mood. Ohhh... "Of June" makes us happy...
very happy indeed!"



Owl City offers perfect combinations of laid-back, relaxing
"feel-good" music amidst the polite nod to the golden "pre-adolescent"
1980&#039;s days when New Wave ruled the music realm with bands like Human
League, New Order, Howard Jones, Pet Shop Boys and Depeche Mode. "Of
June" is a charming, effervescent listen because it is, in a sense,
fresh re-created New Wave perfectly designed and crafted to meet the
needs of our imaginations.
